title: Future value
summary: Future value is the value of an asset at a specific date.[1] It measures the nominal future sum of money that a given sum of money is "worth" at a specified time in the future assuming a certain interest rate, or more generally, rate of return; it is the present value multiplied by the accumulation function.[2] The value does not include corrections for inflation or other factors that affect the true value of money in the future.  This is used in time value of money calculations.
